channel.title: Redesigning BIOS
channel.description:
What I mean, it the startup screen. [img]http://polishlinux.org/wp-content/uploads/2007/10/post.jpg[/img]
Could we make it say Mopar Computer instead of Sun Modular BIOS? I would guess we would re-write it in either Assembly or machine code. What do you think? (not my startup screen by the way)

item.title: Redesigning BIOS
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“benny679, post:8, topic:354240”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=450534.msg3305343#msg3305343 date=1281626835]
Who the fuck would want there computer to say mopar computer. Unless moparisthebest has a car pc in one of his mopar vehicles. Even then its a 1-3 second screen that you see and a complete waste of time.
[/quote]

What the fuck do you mean its an example. This is exactly what you wanted to do, don’t lie to yourself.
Is an example asshole.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Redesigning BIOS
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:11, topic:354240”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=450534.msg3307795#msg3307795 date=1281789259]

machine code is something that can be fed directly into a cpu… assembler is a language??

is assembler not simply a set of mnemonics for machine code opcodes?

yes? how does that make them the same?

i think he’s trying to point out that writing in machine code or assembly would accomplish the exact same thing?
[/quote]
i doubt it since writing in c or assembly would accomplish the same thing too…[/quote]
when you write in assembly, you’re essentially writing machine code because the mnemonics usually translate directly into a single opcode.

Read full topic

item.description:

machine code is something that can be fed directly into a cpu… assembler is a language??

is assembler not simply a set of mnemonics for machine code opcodes?

yes? how does that make them the same?
[/quote]
i think he’s trying to point out that writing in machine code or assembly would accomplish the exact same thing?[/quote]
i doubt it since writing in c or assembly would accomplish the same thing too…

item.title: Redesigning BIOS
item.dc:creator: @benny679 benny679
item.description:
@benny679 wrote:

Maybe… machine code is 0’s and 1’s while assembly is text formed and readable by people. Easier at least. Could you understand 010001100 in 2 seconds?

EDIT: Machine code is binary…

Read full topic
